author: S Vijay Kumar
text:
The founder of the Abdul Kalam Vision India Party (AVIP), Ponraj, on Friday joined issue with family members of late President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam who had questioned the name of his political outfit.

Kalam’s kin had on Sunday last expressed displeasure at Mr. Ponraj, who was formerly associated with the late President, for politically using the name and image of Kalam. Asked about this at a press conference here, Mr. Ponraj said Kalam’s grandnephew Sheikh Salim, who raised objections, had actually joined the BJP in the presence of party president Amit Shah “barely three months after the passing away of Kalam.”

Mr Ponraj added: “I have great regard and respect for Kalam’s family.” According to him, AVIP was launched by thousands of youth, particularly students, who invited him to take the lead. “I am mentoring them now. In case they want me to take the lead, I am willing to do so…the ultimate goal is only to realise the vision of Abdul Kalam,” he contended.

Meanwhile, the AVIP and Gandhiya Makkal Iyakkam, an outfit headed by Tamilaruvi Manian, who has had stints in various parties since the 1960s and has in the past backed different parties, formed the ‘Alternative Political Front’.

The AVIP’s website www.abdulkalamvip.org was also launched.
title: Ponraj joins issue with Kalam’s kin
